citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A written program of veterinary care was not available for review at the time of inspection. The facility employs an
Attending Veterinarian on a part-time basis who is responsible for overseeing the veterinary care provided to all the
animals at the facility, however, there is no written program documented regarding veterinary care for these animals. A
written program of veterinary care for part-time attending veterinarians is crucial to ensure animals are receiving proper
medical care and that the facility is following their attending veterinarian's guidance. The licensee must develop a written
program of veterinary care for all regulated animals at the facility in accordance with 2.40(a)(1). Correct by August 27,
2024.

Records of acquisition and disposition of animals were not available for review at the time of inspection for 6 sheep, 2
goats, and 25 chickens. Missing and incomplete acquisition and disposition information interferes with the inspection
process, and the ability to track the movement of regulated animals and ensure their humane care and use. The licensee
must make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose all of the required information in
2.75(b)(1) for animals other than dogs and cats, purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased, or otherwise in
his or her possession or under his or her control, or which is transported, sold, euthanized, or otherwise disposed of by
that dealer or exhibitor. The record shall include any offspring born of any animal while in his or her possession or under
his or her control. Correct by August 27, 2024.

The licensee has not developed a contingency plan for the facility. The lack of an adequate contingency plan could
increase the risk of not being able to safeguard animals during emergencies or disasters. The facility must develop,
document and follow an appropriate plan to provide for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing and care
of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster that could reasonably be anticipated for the species at the site.
The plan must address all the components of section 2.134. Correct by September 20, 2024.
This is a continuation of the report for the routine inspection conducted 8/20/2024 and contains the remaining non-
compliances found during the inspection. The exit briefing for the items included on this report was conducted on
8/20/2024.
This inspection was conducted with a facility representative on 8/20/2024. The exit interview was conducted with a facility
representative on 8/20/2024.
